item.title: Capcom Platinum Titles sales update – as of December 31, 2024
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/capcom-platinum-titles-sales-update-as-of-december-31-2024

Resident Evil 4 remake surpasses 9.2 million units.

Capcom has updated its list of “Platinum Titles“—games that have sold over one million units—providing total sales numbers as of December 31, 2024.

Notable updates include:

  • Resident Evil 4 remake (PS5, PS4, Xbox Series, PC) has sold 9.2 million units (1.2 million additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Monster Hunter World: Iceborne (PS4, Xbox One, PC) has sold 14.9 million units (900,00 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Monster Hunter Rise (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC) has sold 16.7 million units (700,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Monster Hunter Rise: Sunbreak (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC) has sold 9.4 million units (600,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Resident Evil 2 (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, PC) has sold 15 million units (500,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Monster Hunter: World (PS4, Xbox One, PC) has sold 21.3 million units (400,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Resident Evil 3 remake (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, PC) has sold 9.6 million units (400,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Resident Evil 7 biohazard (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, PC) has sold 14.4 million units (400,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Resident Evil Village (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, PC) has sold 10.9 million units (400,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Street Fighter 6 (PS5, PS4, Xbox Series, PC) has sold 4.4 million units (300,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Capcom Arcade Stadium (PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC) has sold 2.6 million units (200,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium (PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PC) has sold two million units (200,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Devil May Cry 5 (PS4, Xbox One, PC) has sold 8.9 million units (200,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Dragon’s Dogma II (PS5, Xbox Series, PC) has sold 3.5 million units (200,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin (PS4, Switch, PC) has sold 2.1 million units (100,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Resident Evil 6 (Switch) has sold 1.1 million units (100,000 additional units since September 30, 2024)
  • Devil May Cry 5 Special Edition (PS5, Xbox Series) has sold one million units N

item.title: Tokimeki Memorial: forever with you Emotional launches May 8 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/tokimeki-memorial-forever-with-you-emotional-launches-may-8-in-japan

  • Switch

Available in standard and Deluxe editions.

Romance visual novel remaster Tokimeki Memorial: forever with you Emotional will launch for Switch on May 8 in Japan, Konami announced.

The standard edition will cost 6,600 yen, while the Deluxe Edition will cost 9,680 yen. Both will be available physically and digitally. The Deluxe Edition includes a digital content set featuring the opening movie without subtitles; the digital soundtrack with background music from Tokimeki Memorial (1994) and Tokimeki Memorial: forever with you Emotional (1995, 1996); and a gallery of over 280 character illustration used for key visuals, merchandise, and other promotional content.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nintendo eShop:

About

Tokimeki Memorial is a romance simulation game celebrating its 30th anniversary.

Tokimeki Memorial: Forever with You Emotional is built around the concept of “reliving memories, just as they were, on Nintendo Switch,” with the original game’s feel and gameplay carefully preserved.

Additionally, new features such as the “Emotional Voice System” (EVS) and the ability to switch between new and original character illustrations are available for players to enjoy.

Emotional Voice System (EVS)

EVS is a feature first introduced in Tokimeki Memorial 2, and later used in the series, where characters will call your name using their voice. Several preset names are included in the game, but a network connection is required if you wish to create a new name. (Note: The ability to create new names for EVS may be discontinued at any time, with prior notice.)

Switchable Character Illustrations

You can switch character illustrations (both portraits and stills) during after-school events and dates, as well as change the window’s font.

You can choose from the following four combinations:

  • Original – Uses the original character illustrations and fonts.
  • Original + New Font – Uses the original character illustrations, but some fonts are high-resolution versions.
  • New Graphics – Uses new character illustrations, while the command selection screen uses the original font.
  • New Graphics + New Font – Uses new character illustrations and some high-resolution fonts.

(Note: Even if you select the new font, the user interface, such as icons, will remain unchanged from the original.)

  • Shiori Fujisaki (voiced by Mami Kingetsu)
  • Mio Kisaragi (voiced by Akiko Sekine)
  • Yuina Himoo (voiced by Tomoko Naka)
  • Ayako Katagiri (voiced by Masayo Kawaguchi)
  • Saki Nijino (voiced by Sachiko Sugawara)
  • Yukari Koshiki (voiced by Ayako Kurosaki)
  • Nozomi Kiyokawa (voiced by Ayako Sasaki)
  • Mira Kagami (voiced by Rei Igarashi)
  • Yuuko Asahina (voiced by Youko Teppouzuka)
  • Megumi Mikihara (voiced by Mikiko Kurihara)
  • Yoshio Saotome (voiced by Kurin Yoshiki)
  • Miharu Tatebayashi (voiced by Shiho Kikuchi)
  • Rei Ijuuin (voiced by Narumi Tsunoda)
